title: Mechanistic Interpretability of Language and Vision Models
description: Reverse engineering and explaining the internal representations of language and vision models with mechanistic interpretability.

title: Linking saliency with modulations along the visual processing hierarchy
description: Analyzing a large fMRI dataset (the NSD dataset) to create 'brain-derived' deep learning models for activity prediction. Designing saliency metrics for stimuli and identifying correlations with retinotopic activity in visual, parietal, and prefrontal regions of the brain.

title: Inferring neuronal computation from partial observations
description: Investigated methods for inferring a neuron's computations from incomplete observations of its inputs and outputs. Simulated neurons as hierarchical linear-nonlinear models using PyTorch and utilized gradient descent methods to infer parameters.
institution: Allen Institute of Brain Sciences, Seattle

title: Investigating the physiology of aging across genetically diverse mouse population
description: Analyzed biological time-series data with machine learning and computational modeling. Developed a health index to summarize aging properties across genetically diverse mouse populations.

title: Cloud Infrastructure Automation for Health Checks and Maintenance
description: Worked on a proprietary cloud infrastructure platform for monitoring the health of cloud instances and load balancing. Developed tools for automating cloud instance health checks and maintenance.

title: Formal Language Modeling of Biological Networks
description: Analyzed biological networks such as gene regulatory networks (GRNs) using formal language and automata theory. Focused on fault analysis of GRNs and modeled stochasticity using probabilistic boolean networks.

title: Machine Learning for Coronary Heart Disease Prediction
description: Used machine learning and deep learning models to understand the biological parameters influencing heart diseases. Compared various models for their performance in predicting coronary heart disease.

title: Analysis of neural patterns between face and shape recognition
description: Worked on the Human Connectome Project (HCP) dataset at Neuromatch Academy, analyzing neural patterns between face and shape recognition in the brain.

title: Protein engineering with deep learning
description: Worked on prediction of biophysical properties of enzymes created through directed evolution. Experimented with various machine learning and deep learning models and analyzed high throughput data for protein mutation samples.

title: Machine learning for cancer prognosis using biomedical image data
description: Analyzed biomedical image samples with machine learning and deep learning models. Performed biomedical image segmentation with convolutional neural networks and classified MR images using 3-D voxel data.

title: Custom JupyterHub AWS instance with automated load balancing
description: Developed a proof of concept AWS JupyterHub cluster using Kubernetes for internal company resources. Worked on automating load management and custom login protocol based on internal authentication.
